image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann walks away as a TV camera films him.

props.synopsis: With his defamation appeal dismissed and legal costs rising, Bruce Lehrmann is almost out of options. A High Court bid is possible, but what would it take to get there?

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann is running out of courts to continue his legal battle

image.altText: A man with short blonde hair and glasses stands outdoors looking slightly confused.

props.synopsis: After being named leader of the Canberra Liberals last month, Mark Parton announces a reshuffled shadow cabinet after Leanne Castley stepped down from the role.

title.children: Canberra Liberals leader Mark Parton announces new shadow cabinet

image.altText: A man with dark hair and glasses in a suit.

props.synopsis: Bruce Lehrmann has lost his appeal against a Federal Court ruling that found, on the balance of probabilities, he raped his then-colleague Brittany Higgins in 2019.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann may turn to High Court following appeal loss: lawyer

image.altText: A Qantas Boeing 737-800 aircraft is seen landing at Sydney Domestic Airport

props.synopsis: A data-entry mistake by a Qantas employee set off a series of errors that caused a Boeing 737 to take off slower than it should have.

title.children: Typing error 'cascaded' into series of mistakes on Qantas flight

image.altText: A person in an Akubra hat silhouetted against an Indigenous flag.

props.synopsis: Senior ACT public servants will soon be required to demonstrate their work towards ending the inequality experienced by First Nations people.

title.children: ACT public servants legally required to uphold 'Closing the Gap principle'

image.altText: A woman with red hair pulled back stands outdoors speaking seriously.

props.synopsis: ACT Attorney-General Tara Cheyne is found to have breached the code of conduct for a parliamentarian over an anonymous text message she sent criticising former Canberra Liberals leader Elizabeth Lee.

title.children: ACT minister's text criticising backbencher breached code of conduct

image.altText: The sign for School of Music adorns a concrete building, winter trees in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The Australian National University has abandoned a controversial plan to absorb its School of Music into a single course after extraordinary public pressure.

title.children: ANU backflips on plan to axe the School of Music after public pressure

image.altText: 25-year-old Canberra man charged with multiple counts of dangerous driving

props.synopsis: A Canberra man has been jailed over a string of road rage attacks committed "for trivial reasons", and fined $10,000 for performing a Nazi salute outside a Queensland synagogue.

title.children: Canberra man who performed Nazi salute jailed over road rage incidents

image.altText: Hundreds of overflowing cardboard boxes full of donated second-hand items in a large warehouse.

props.synopsis: Canberra's biggest charities dumped almost 600 tonnes of waste last financial year, with the declining quality of donations a key factor in goods ending up as landfill.

title.children: Vinnies takes most waste to ACT landfill as overall charity waste declines

image.altText: A room with a dentist chair is surrounded by masks of men on the wall

props.synopsis: Democrats say the newly released images provide a "harrowing look" into Jeffrey Epstein's world, as the late sex offender's jailed accomplice, Ghislaine Maxwell, informs a court she is planning to challenge her imprisonment.

title.children: Images of Epstein's island released as Maxwell flags bid for freedom

image.altText: Illustration of a person sitting below cards and dice that are rising above him

props.synopsis: Chat logs and gambling data show the tactics used by Australian-run online casino Stake to keep one user hooked.

title.children: One player's case against the world's biggest crypto casino

image.altText: Ted Egan smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Folk music legend, author and former Northern Territory Administrator Ted Egan has died aged 93.

title.children: Former NT administrator, musician and author Ted Egan dies aged 93

image.altText: Richard Marles and Pat Conroy press conference

props.synopsis: The acting prime minister says the United States is fully supportive of AUKUS and has thanked it for providing a review. Follow live.

title.children: Marles says he is 'working through' a AUKUS review from the US

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Breaking: Australia 'working through' Pentagon review into AUKUS, Marles says
Wong, DFAT chief won't say if more Australians who travelled to Syria for ISIS will return

image.altText: A digitally blended composite image comprised of people and the RBA

props.synopsis: A leading economist says the "risk" of an "imminent" RBA interest rate hike is "rising", while former treasurer Peter Costello is urging Australia to arrest its fertility downturn. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Risk of 'imminent' RBA rate hike rising

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Bitcoin losing street cred? Analysis by Ian Verrender
Tobacco black market big enough for ABS ruler

image.altText: A young child holds a mobile phone with a padlock graphic embossed over the top.

props.synopsis: Today marks the unofficial start of the teen social media ban. Here's everything you need to know.

title.children: The teen social media ban is here. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: An old woman and man, both wearing glasses, sit on chairs around a round wooden table

props.synopsis: The family of the late first wife of High Country killer Greg Lynn says a fresh investigation into her death has stalled because police will not pay for an expert report.

title.children: Fresh probe into Lisa Lynn's death stalls over $9,000 bill, family says

image.altText: A heavily damaged house surrounded by trees.

props.synopsis: Indonesia's government says it will summon eight companies over their suspected role in worsening the scale of floods and landslides that have killed more than 700 people. But environmental groups say authorities are hypocritical and partly to blame for the destruction.

title.children: Palm oil and mining blamed for cyclone devastation in Sumatra

image.altText: A man with grey hair and grey beard, in a patterned shirt, holding the neck of a guitar, vertically by his head.

props.synopsis: Steve Cropper, was best known as the guitarist for Booker T and the MG's, but also co-wrote the classics Green Onions, and In the Midnight Hour.

title.children: Legendary guitarist and songwriter Steve Cropper dies aged 84

image.altText: A crowd of people gathered with some waving banners and flags while Big Ben looms behind them in the background

props.synopsis: Two of the UK's leading groups for women and girls will stop offering membership to trans women in the aftermath of a Supreme Court ruling.

title.children: Leading groups for UK women and girls to close doors for trans women

image.altText: Donatella Versace smiles and poses for a photo with five models, all in sparkly silver dresses

props.synopsis: With Prada buying Versace, one of fashion's biggest rivalries is over — and it will be hoping to bring the fellow Italian fashion house back into style.

title.children: Versace excelled at maximalism. Now Prada wants to take it further

image.altText: A composite of Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Vladimir Putin.

props.synopsis: After a flurry of meetings, Russia's war in Ukraine continues. So where is the peace process at?

title.children: Here's what experts say about the Russia–Ukraine peace process

image.altText: dog and man on couch

props.synopsis: A man who allegedly misled police over the theft of his vehicle and family pet has been charged with driving offences and obstructing police.

title.children: Man who allegedly abandoned dog Arnie facing additional charges

image.altText: Travis Head looks over his shoulder as he completes a shot.

props.synopsis: The second Ashes Test is upon us and we have fingers crossed it will last more than two days. Here's everything you need to know.

title.children: What time does the Gabba Test start and everything else you need to know

image.altText: Aerial shot of cars

props.synopsis: A man charged with murder is refused bail as another faces extradition over a shooting on the NSW North Coast that left one man dead and two others injured.

title.children: Second man set to be charged with murder over Northern Rivers shooting

image.altText: A raccoon is seen passed out on a bathroom floor, in between a black bin and a white toilet.

props.synopsis: The suspect broke into a liquor store in the US state of Virginia, ransacked several shelves and ended up face down in the bathroom.

title.children: Raccoon goes on liquor binge and passes out in toilet

image.altText: Black and white image of Jimmy Barnes in a white singlet in an open space staring at the camera.

props.synopsis: Cold Chisel was over. America beckoned. And Jimmy Barnes was terrified. This is the story of the album that made him, and the song that saved him.

title.children: Jimmy Barnes's American gamble didn't pay off — but he has no regrets

image.altText: Pete Hegseth looking at the camera with a stern expression and furrowed brow.

props.synopsis: A report by the Pentagon watchdog concludes US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth violated Pentagon policy by using his personal device for official business and recommends better training for all Pentagon officials.

title.children: Hegseth's use of Signal app posed risk to US personnel, watchdog finds

image.altText: A pencil drawing of a man surrounded by a vortex of redress scheme forms

props.synopsis: An independent audit of the National Redress Scheme has found wait times are increasing and causing significant distress to survivors of child sexual abuse.

title.children: Child sexual abuse victims face anxious wait for redress via official scheme

image.altText: Man in front of a microphone gesticulating in a radio studio mid sentence  wearing a black t-shirt.

props.synopsis: A community radio station in Alice Springs is becoming a breeding ground for new, diverse voices by giving people with disability a platform to broadcast.

title.children: People with disability 'blossom like a flower' on community radio

image.altText: aa middle aged man with greying hair and glasses

props.synopsis: A California doctor is imprisoned for illegally supplying Friends sitcom star Matthew Perry with ketamine, the powerful sedative that caused the actor's drug overdose death in 2023.

title.children: Doctor in Matthew Perry overdose case jailed

image.altText: A man in blue shirt in front of a new headstone and a red flower wreath next to older graves

props.synopsis: South Australian high school students have helped to uncover the legacies of five war veterans who were laid to rest in unmarked graves.

title.children: Students help uncover forgotten stories of WWI veterans and nurses

image.altText: Macquarie Point render, Hurricanes game

props.synopsis: The Hobart stadium is unofficially approved after securing enough yes votes, but the $1.13 billion project is still being scrutinised in the Tasmanian parliament. Follow the debate live.

title.children: Hobart's stadium debate continues, with project unofficially approved

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Live coverage of day two of Hobart stadium debate and vote
What questions do you have about the next steps?

image.altText: A group of wind turbines dotted along a hillside against a hazy blue sky

props.synopsis: An energy watchdog says more renewable energy is projected to lower prices, but others warn the promise is illusory and more pain is coming.

title.children: Watchdog flags 5 per cent fall in power prices amid renewables surge

image.altText: A large bronze sculpture of a gorilla that has been installed in a park.

props.synopsis: A statue of a 30-year-old eastern lowland gorilla named Mina is one of 22 donated to Eurobodalla Shire Council by internationally recognised artists Gillie and Marc.

title.children: $1.6m art installation, including 3-metre gorilla, gets town talking
